Description.Text: Hotel Verta also offers fantastic SPA, The Falconbrook Spa experience includes a spa vitality suite, fitness room, vitality pool and thermal rooms. 7 meeting rooms and Rooftop Event Space are available for between 10- 200 delegates, with natural daylight and panoramic views of The Thames and the London Heliport.

Hotel Verta is situated at London's Vertical Gateway, The London Heliport, Battersea, that really is something unique.Hotel Verta sits on the south side of the River Thames, opposite Chelsea Harbour Pier and close to Clapham Junction rail station.Clapham Junction provides easy access to several interconnecting underground lines throughout the city.

Hotel Verta has 70 rooms including 4 suites with infinity baths overlooking the Thames, Hotel Verta has managed to capture the essence of the modest Jazz age spirit that defined the golden age of aviation. Beautiful furniture is offset by rich pickings related to the area's heritage; relevant books and local maps blend into an area where every modern comfort is catered for. Furniture is ultra modern yet wouldn't look out of place in the jazz age, or golden age of air travel for that matter. Staying at in one of our bedrooms is like watching a classic film on the latest technology. Flat screen televisions provide the gateway to in-room entertainment delivered by cutting edge digital IPTV. From the television, guests can select from a large number of movies on demand, international and UK channels, music on demand, browse the web and even play games. WIFI internet access is available. Guests can control the sophisticated and energy efficient in room heating and lighting system using touch sensitive glass controllers. All rooms from metropolitan rooms to suites are equipped with Shower, TV, Telephone, Air Conditioning, Bathroom Amenities, Toilet, Bathroom, Tea/Coffee Maker, Wake Up Service/Alarm Clock, Work Desk, Ironing Facilities, Seating Area, DVD Player, CD Player. Superior rooms Have separate shower and bath, additional show storage. Deluxe rooms are located at the City end of the building or the Garden side. Some rooms have an additional seating area.
The building is new and contemporary , mainly contracted of glass windows.

The restaurant is called Patrisey, with traditional British and European cuisine, the menu is as extravagant as its aviation surroundings. Lobster Thermidor and the Verta Burger provide an interesting topic between enthusiastic cab drivers and helicopter pilots.A featured wall of wine creates a unique piece of "wine art" as you enter Patrisey Restaurant The "wine as art" wine list includes a paired down connoisseurs list showcasing the best of New World with a peppering of Old World vintage. At Patrisey, you can choose your dining experience depending on your mood and the occasion...the budding chefs can watch their food being prepared whilst dining at a table with the kitchen in full view, couples can retreat and hideaway behind the metallic leaf and frosted fretwork for an intimate dining experience and colleagues can talk over lunch with the only interruption being the superb sight of helicopters landing.You also can enjoy a glass of champagne at the Champagne and cocktail Bar called Vertilon cantilevering over the Thames.
Lobby is medium size with ultra modern reception desk.
